name: gusplease
text: The James Joyce of Achewood strips.

name: catachresis
text: This one doesn't really make me laugh anymore but I rated it 5 for services to the english language

name: stuart
text: Like most services involving the English language these days, this service's provider was outsourced (to Vlad).

name: deimosrising
text: This strip taught me an important lesson, and going forward I'm hoping there will be less women who hate me

name: overmedicated
text: Give me my rad chilies goddamit!

name: centipede_damascus
text: How does a Russian robot have such a way with the English language?

name: gormster
text: Is such movink target!

name: invidious
text: Ask Nabokov...

name: ssddr
text: The concept of a guitar being described as ugliest is great.

name: mastronaut
text: I have used this phrase on several occasions.

name: 21echoes
text: http://www.meatsandfishes.com/apology/index.php?date=2006-06-29

name: epicurus
text: I have been Ray in panel 5 many times.

name: farqussus
text: I understand the words you are saying, but not how they should represent a problem to me.

name: echidnaboy
text: "She's mad that I didn't call her for a long time? But I'm calling her now, so she should be happy! Right?"

name: 1000hz
text: Royal advice from the King of Make-outs.

name: philosophe
text: I can't get over his little smile as he says it.

name: stuart
text: That's how Vlad always looks.

name: phthoggos
text: holy shit, is that a smile or the bottom of his lip/chin?

name: stuart
text: It occasionally changes shape, yet nonetheless I still assume the latter. Also, in the "Tasty Dudes" picture, his beard frames it. It's his mouth, but I don't believe it.

name: rowboat
text: I can only see it as his chin. I always thought his mouth was under his mustache. Could be wrong. These little confusions over what part is what on various characters' faces is pretty common among the posters here. The craziest one I read was someone who thought that the top line of Teodor's muzzle was a big frown. They thought his whole snout was a big chin. Now that's fucked up.

name: sdskyle
text: I always thought it was the bottom of his lip...

name: jonmw
text: I think that it's the lower edge of his lip.

name: gus
text:
Lower lip, but it's one of those weird shift-of perspective things once you notice it. It can easily be seen as a smile, and now I keep seeing lowerlip/smile/lowerlip.

Kind of like ancient Funky Winkerbean cartoons where the noses looked like smiles, and once you saw them that way, it was hard not to see them that way every time.

name: bhlaab
text: the rad chillies version was actually a lot better

name: ttagxamm
text:
I'm sorry, I just can't agree: it loses too much without the worst song/ugliest guitar phrase.

But here it is, for ease of comparison.

name: echidnaboy
text: This one works better as a strip, but "rad chilies" is godlike. Achewood is so good, even the rejected strips contain nuggets of genius.

name: miaou
text:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but it appears the link does not point anymore to the "rad chilies" version.
Can any oldschooler please tell me in which ways it differed from the above?

text:
try here:
http://achewood.com/rsrc/img/07172002_orig.gif

name: miaou
text: My sincere thanks, catt!

name: zem
text: heres a link you can click on

name: snatch22
text: I forgot that rad chilies originated there...  I can't believe there's a hot sauce named after a strip that wasn't officially released.

name: spinynorman
text: As I first began to read Achewood, it was like Vlad was the center of all comedy, and no other.

name: f1shst1ck
text: coldest insult of all time

name: morbo
text: How are you all seeing the alternate version?

name: ttagxamm
text: I linked it just a few posts upscreen.

name: error23
text: Did the alternate version have an alt-text?

name: spinynorman
text: Vlad really was one of the strongest players in Ye Olde Achewood days.

name: spinynorman
text: Goddamn it, I said that already like three months ago, and now I just said it again. What the fuck.

name: mog
text:
5 for Vlad


Bring him back!

name: semiquaver
text: The contrast on this is awful...and look at the weird dithering on the "LATER" bar in panel five.  Oh look here I am bitching about image quality in a comic with minimalist art oh damn.

name: phthoggos
text:
It's in Vlad's hair too

OH GOD IT'S EVERYWHERE

name: semiquaver
text: ITS ON THE FOOD

name: madnes
text: Some even got on the mayor!

name: baryonyx
text: I imagine this one is just to represent you standing there with a look of shock and aghast self-loathing on your face with a hand cupped over your mouth.

name: semiquaver
text: This is the only forum on the internet in which a blank post garners mixed reactions and any form of critical discussion.

name: zem
text: completely false

name: snowman
text: "draw them curtains" = sick!

name: belgand
text: I am uncertain as to the intended meaning of this phrase. Clearly the cat wishes to have sexual relations with the lady to whom he is talking, but does it mean that they would be drawing the curtains across the windows so as to prevent passers-by from viewing them as they conjugate or would this be a vulgar phrasing intended to refer to the opening of her lady-parts in such a manner as to imply her desire for penetration and the beginning of congress.

name: hawaiian_robot
text: Drawing the, "Beef Curtains", I would suppose

text: Vlad is like the robotic Russian casanova from hell.
